pageContext.claim: “Can anyone even imagine having Spies placed in a competing campaign, by the people and party in absolute power, for the sole purpose of political advantage and gain? And to think that the party in question, even with the expenditure of far more money, LOST!”
pageContext.analysis: The informant worked for the FBI. The Clinton campaign did not place him there. There is no evidence the informant was used for "political advantage." Indeed, the major story that that ran on alleged Russia links before the election, in the New York Times, said the FBI could not find evidence of links.
